DataElement.preferredName: Patient Off Treatment Off Study Reason Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to describe the explanation for a patient no longer participating in a clinical trial, or in the treatment portion of a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Off Treatment Off Study Reason
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Off-Treatment; the phase of a protocol during which a patient does not receive treatment._No longer participating in a study; not being followed and will not be retreated._An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: Off-Treatment; the phase of a protocol during which a patient does not receive treatment.:No longer participating in a study; not being followed and will not be retreated.:An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

Concepts.definition: When a patient is not receiving therapy they are considered off treatment.  In clinical trials, a dosing schedule may require a patient to stop medication for a period of time, then resume, such as 28 days on and 7 days off.
No longer participating in a study; not being followed and will not be retreated.
An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: justification for or explanation of the administration or cessation of therapy.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Off Treatment Off Study Reason Reason Code
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Text categories for the reason that a person on a nontreatment study comes off study._When a patient is not receiving therapy they are considered off treatment.  In clinical trials, a dosing schedule may require a patient to stop medication for a period of time, then resume, such as 28 days on and 7 days off._No longer participating in a study; not being followed and will not be retreated._An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Off-Treatment; the phase of a protocol during which a patient does not receive treatment.: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.: An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: To or at a greater distance in time or space.: A type of study protocol designed to evaluate intervention(s) for disease treatment.: To decline to do, accept, give, or allow something.

Concepts.definition: To or at a greater distance in time or space.
A type of study protocol designed to evaluate intervention(s) for disease treatment.
To decline to do, accept, give, or allow something.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The absence of life or state of being dead.: The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed.

Concepts.definition: This gene plays a role in apoptosis, inflammation, septic shock, and wound healing.

The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed; an activity that continues something that has already begun or that repeats something that has already been done.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Late Determination of Eligibility
Lost to Further Follow-up
An event or decision that stands in contrast to the guidelines set out by the protocol.

Concepts.definition: An event or decision that stands in contrast to the guidelines set out by the protocol.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Refused Further Follow-up

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Off study during follow-up - other reasons

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Off study during follow-up - other reasons
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No longer participating in a study; not being followed and will not be retreated.: At some point in a given period of time.: The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed.: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.: An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

Concepts.definition: No longer participating in a study; not being followed and will not be retreated.
At some point in a given period of time.

The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed; an activity that continues something that has already begun or that repeats something that has already been done.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being or occurring at an advanced period of time or after a usual or expected time.: Any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, regardless of whether or not it is considered related to the product or procedure (attribution of unrelated, unlikely, possible, probable, or definite). The concept refers to events that could be medical product related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another therapy or procedure, or caused by opioid initiation or dose escalation. The term also is referred to as an adverse experience. The old term Side Effect is retired and should not be used.

Concepts.definition: Being or occurring at an advanced period of time or after a usual or expected time.

Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A clinical study status designating the study has been completed normally, according to the protocol. Subject enrollment stopped. No participants are treated or being followed up.

Concepts.definition: A clinical study status designating the study has been completed normally, according to the protocol. Subject enrollment stopped. No participants are treated or being followed up.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed.: A means of finding a solution to a problem, or a means of finding agreement or harmony.

Concepts.definition: The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed; an activity that continues something that has already begun or that repeats something that has already been done.
A means of finding a solution to a problem, or a means of finding agreement or harmony.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A type of study protocol designed to evaluate intervention(s) for disease treatment.: A means of finding a solution to a problem, or a means of finding agreement or harmony.: The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed.: Existing in time or space without stop or interruption.

Concepts.definition: A type of study protocol designed to evaluate intervention(s) for disease treatment.
A means of finding a solution to a problem, or a means of finding agreement or harmony.

The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed; an activity that continues something that has already begun or that repeats something that has already been done.
Remain in force or carry on without letup; keep or maintain in unaltered condition; exist in time or space without stop or interruption.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Adverse Events/Side Effects
Complicating Disease/Intercurrent Illness

The branch of biology that studies the cellular aspects of heredity, especially the chromosomes. Includes the study of disease states caused by numerical and structural chromosome abnormalities.: A Resistance Process consists of activities of biologic molecules or complexes involved in processes that maintain immunity to, or counteract, defeat, or withstand the effects of, an antagonistic agent.

Concepts.definition: The branch of biology that studies the cellular aspects of heredity, especially the chromosomes. Includes the study of disease states caused by numerical and structural chromosome abnormalities.

A Resistance Process consists of activities of biologic molecules or complexes involved in processes that maintain immunity to, or counteract, defeat, or withstand the effects of, an antagonistic agent.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Death While on Study
Declining to take part in activities or procedures that are available to, or requested or expected of, an individual.

Concepts.definition: Declining to take part in activities or procedures that are available to, or requested or expected of, an individual.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Available in place of something else.: A type of study protocol designed to evaluate intervention(s) for disease treatment.: The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.

Concepts.definition: Available in place of something else.
A type of study protocol designed to evaluate intervention(s) for disease treatment.
The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Used to indicate that an event is to immediately follow another event.: Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, mechanism of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiology, behavior and health services research. : Cancer that is increasing in scope or severity.

Concepts.definition: Used to indicate that an event is to immediately follow another event.

Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, study of mechanisms of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiologic, behavior, and health services research.
A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.: A type of study protocol designed to evaluate intervention(s) for disease treatment.: An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.
A type of study protocol designed to evaluate intervention(s) for disease treatment.
An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.: An action plan for a clinical trial.  The plan states what the study will do, how, and why.  It explains how many people will be in it, who is eligible to participate, what study agents or other interventions they will be given, what tests they will receive and how often, and what information will be gathered.: A type of study protocol designed to evaluate intervention(s) for disease treatment.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

A formal document that describes a complete plan of research activity in the framework of a clinical study; specifically, the study objective(s), design, methodology, eligibility requests for prospective subjects and controls; intervention regimen(s), proposed methods of analysis of data; statistical considerations, and organization of the study. The protocol usually also provides the background and rationale for the study, but these could be represented in other protocol referenced documents.
A type of study protocol designed to evaluate intervention(s) for disease treatment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.: Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.: A type of study protocol designed to evaluate intervention(s) for disease treatment.: Cancer that continues to grow or spread.

Concepts.definition: Earlier in time or order.
Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.
A type of study protocol designed to evaluate intervention(s) for disease treatment.
A process that manifests as the worsening of a disease over time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: justification for or explanation of the administration or cessation of therapy.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support the Theradex CRF/Off treatment/Off study, which is a composite of the Off Treatment and Off Study standards.
